page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: Topographically the region can be divided into 3 areas that run n-s: to the east is an area of Rhaetic/Lwr. Lias rocks at a height of 160 m. To the west is a lowland of Keuper Marl. A scarp face marks the junction of the two. Pastoral agriculture dominates the landscape. Where the contours allow this is intensively managed. In the south-west corner of the area are the two small villages of West and East Harptree, and the hamlet of Hinton Blewitt is in the south-east corner. Children from Hinton go to school in Temple Cloud, by School Transport, while there is a school in East Harptree just south of the survey area.To the north-west is the Chew Valley Lake, an important reservoir and centre for water sports and wildfowl.
